etymology.description: Depicts target for arrows -> representation of marquis as distant goal
etymology.interpretation: Originally a pictogram showing a target for arrows, this character captures the idea of a marquis as a distant, lofty position to aim for. The visual metaphor aligns the role of a marquis, often considered a noble target or goal within a hierarchy, with the target imagery.

examples.english: He was conferred the title of marquis.

examples.chinese: 他出身名门(他出身名門)，后来晋升为侯(後來晉升為侯)。
examples.pinyin: Tā chūshēn míngmén, hòulái jìnshēng wéi hóu.
examples.english: He was born into a famous family, and later promoted to marquis.
